intro: Ligusticopsis wallichiana, commonly known as the Himalayan angelica, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in umbels. It is valued for its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional medicine. Its growth habit and botanical characteristics make it well adapted to cold, mountainous environments.
